name: Longest Distance Wheeled
description: Select the longest distance the patient wheels & code his/her level of independence (Level 1-6) on that distance. Observe performance
exceptions: Not scored if patient does not currently use a WC & is not expected to use a WC
Not about how patient stands up
tips: Select only 1 distance: 1.Wheel 150ft/45m, 2.Wheel 100ft/30m, 3.Wheel 50ft/15m, 4.Wheel in Room Once Seated (at least 10ft)
If patient is unable to wheel or wheels <10 ft, the score is automatically '1. Dependent'
dependent: Patient is dependent in all aspects of mobility. Helper must propel the patient in the WC.
*Note:  The only time this score would be used is if the patient is unable to wheel self any distance at all.
substantial: Patient may be able to advance feet or place heels to the floor in attempts to propel WC/pull WC forward but helper provides >50% of the effort to move the WC forward or maneuver it around obstacles
Patient may be able to place hands on wheels & push/pull wheels but unable to complete one or more revolutions & helper provides >50% of the effort to move the WC forward
partial: Patient able to advance feet & place heels to the floor to propel WC/pull WC forward & helper provides <50% of the effort to move the WC forward or maneuver it around obstacles
Patient able to place hands on wheels & push/pull wheels to achieve some/most of required revolutions to move WC forward, & helper provides <50% of the effort to get started and/or make turns
supervision: Patient requires prompting & cueing for sequencing to fully accomplish mobility distance
There may be concerns about safety when maneuvering WC around obstacles or to avoid self- injury to hands & feet
Touching/Steadying only may be required for hand/foot placement or to complete full step or full revolution of wheels
Touching/Steadying only may be required for assisting patient w/turns
setup: Patient needs helper to prepare for mobility, by removing or adjusting armrests, unlocking brakes, removing or lifting footrests or applying prosthesis/orthosis/special shoes. After activity, helper replaces armrests, leg rests and/or assists with prosthesis/orthosis.
independent: Patient safely propels wheelchair over the distance, making turns and/or moving around obstacles. Patient requires no help w/WC armrests. footrests, brakes or with prosthesis/orthosis/special shoes
